title: System.Environment.NewLine, etc...
body: Ever wonder why a newline is <a href="http://blogs.msdn.com/oldnewthing/archive/2004/03/18/91899.aspx">2 characters (CR+LF)</a>?  Me neither ;-)<br><br>[Edit]: more geeky goodness from the msdn blogs:<br><a href="http://blogs.msdn.com/ericgu/archive/2004/03/16/90724.aspx">How about zero-based arrays</a>?<br><br><a href="http://blogs.msdn.com/LarryOsterman/archive/2004/03/18/92010.aspx">Gargantuan NT paging files</a>?<br><br><a href="http://blogs.msdn.com/ericgu/archive/2004/03/16/90592.aspx">The best way to write out several strings in a row</a>?<br><br><a href="http://blogs.msdn.com/Jeff_Adkins/archive/2004/03/16/90494.aspx">Wtf the deal is with "is" and "as"</a>?<br><br>Just get the whole <a href="http://blogs.msdn.com/MainFeed.aspx">MSDN feedbag here</a>, so many cool geeky MS thingies.
